result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose G Sanchez Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose G Sanchez Chavez

records.addlTxt:
9:42 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose G Sanchez Chavez in court with Attorney Erika Amundson. Spanish Interpreter Monica Marin appears via Zoom and is sworn and interprets. Attorney Amundson states there is a resolution. State recited the agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Obstructing and Officer. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders:
5 days jail granted with Huber or Electronic Monitoring or 40 hours of Community Service - Defendant chooses to complete Community Service
Court costs
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Operating While Revoked. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders: 
Court costs
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

Adjourned: 9:53 AM

9:35 am case called. Defendant Jose G Sanchez Chavez in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Jose G Sanchez Chavez.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense needs a Spanish interpreter.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Erika Amundson at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 09/02/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

10:46 AM Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose G Sanchez Chavez in court without counsel. Defendant requested interpreter. Defendant recently applied for a court appointed attorney. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/24/2022 at 2:45 PM
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
